intro: Aporosa sphaerosperma, commonly known as the globular sphaerosperma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
